content.body: I forget: does it still make sense for AddRestrictedFunctionProperties to exist (as opposed to using more conventional means to declare the properties in question)?
AddRestrictedFunctionProperties looks pretty conventional to me?
* it's syntactically conventional, but it's not how properties of intrinsics are usually 'declared'

m.new_content.body: it's syntactically conventional, but it's not how properties of intrinsics are usually 'declared'

content.body: seems fine to keep it separate, I think, since those properties are conceptually unlike other properties
most other properties exist to be accessed; these exist specifically because they're not supposed to be accessed
(#877 and #1148 are about actually normatively removing the properties themselves, afaict, despite the misleading names)
The `emu-note` notes are really helpful and I wish the spec had even more of them
content.formatted_body: The emu-note notes are really helpful and I wish the spec had even more of them

content.body: especially the longer ones like the one at https://tc39.es/ecma262/multipage/indexed-collections.html#sec-array.prototype.reduce
â€¦which I was reading today in the context of trying to resolve the MDN issue at https://github.com/mdn/content/issues/6156
the wording of that`emu-note` in the spec is more clear than what we have in MDN
content.formatted_body: the wording of thatemu-note in the spec is more clear than what we have in MDN
